body: @gittigxuy Can you add a link to the dataset or show an example of an image + label?

@gittigxuy this sounds similar to the SSD class vector, which has a background class, rather than seperate `obj_conf` and `class_conf` as in YOLO. You would need to restructure the 3 output layers and the loss functions correspondingly.

@gittigxuy @glenn-jocher  I have trained citypersons dataset on this repo, what I did is modify the dataset annotation.  This dataset is mainly for pedestrian detection, and the "ignore" class is annotation for invalid detection, such as a person image on a poster. As I modified, the 'ignore' class is removed, and the other classes such as sitting person and group of person is merged as 'person' class.
@WannaSeaU ,did you test your model?how about the log missing rate?you could download the test code by[ this link](https://bitbucket.org/shanshanzhang/citypersons/downloads/?tab=downloads).

@Jaiczay .the cityperons dataset is a sub-dataset of cityscapes dataset,and shanshan Zhang re-labeled the picture in 2016.you could download the cityscapes dataset and then download the label by this link[https://bitbucket.org/shanshanzhang/citypersons/downloads/?tab=downloads](url)
@gittigxuy I may run this benchmark next monday, the overall quality of inference is ok.

@glenn-jocher  Could you please let me know what do you mean by saying that we should change the losses? For my project I want to calculate the loss on object detection only (i.e. Cross entropy loss).

@apapadaki I haven't personally used citypersons, but if you are training for object detection then you should not need to modify the loss function, as of course yolov3 already does that out of the box. @WannaSeaU might be better able to answer your questions since it seems he's done what you are looking for.
